title: spawning `std::process::Command` in user mode QEMU for a non-existant binary fails to fail

labels.name: O-Arm
labels.description: Target: 32-bit Arm processors (armv6, armv7, thumb...), including 64-bit Arm in AArch32 state

labels.name: T-libs
labels.description: Relevant to the library team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
**I tried this code**: ```rust use std::process::Command; fn main() { match Command::new("/no-binary-by-this-name-should-exist").output() { Err(e) => assert_eq!(e.kind(), std::io::ErrorKind::NotFound), Ok(output) => unreachable!("{:?}", output), } } ``` **I expected to see this happen**: the program finishes without any errors. **Instead, this happened**: a panic is triggered with the message `thread 'main' panicked at 'internal error: entered unreachable code: Output { status: ExitStatus(unix_wait_status(32512)), stdout: "", stderr: "" }', src/main.rs:6:23` ### Meta `rustc --version --verbose`: ``` rustc 1.58.0-nightly (936238a92 2021-11-11) binary: rustc commit-hash: 936238a92b2f9d6e7afe7dda69b4afd903f96399 commit-date: 2021-11-11 host: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu release: 1.58.0-nightly LLVM version: 13.0.0 ``` operating system: `arch linux` kernel version: `5.14.16-arch1-1` the following steps was used to reproduce the bug (for simplicity the reproduction steps were given for armv5te specifically, similar steps can be taken for riscv): * `sudo pacman -S debootstrap`. * `sudo debootstrap sid debian/ http://deb.debian.org/debian` * `sudo systemd-nspawn -D debian` * *setup and login to user account* * `sudo apt install qemu-user gcc-arm-linux-gnueabi` * `curl --proto '=https' --tlsv1.2 -sSf https://sh.rustup.rs | sh` * `rustup target add armv5te-unknown-linux-gnueabi` * `rustc src/main.rs --target=armv5te-unknown-linux-gnueabi -Clinker=arm-linux-gnueabi-gcc` * `qemu-arm -L /usr/arm-linux-gnueabi main`
backtrace

``` stack backtrace: 0: rust_begin_unwind at /rustc/936238a92b2f9d6e7afe7dda69b4afd903f96399/library/std/src/panicking.rs:498:5 1: core::panicking::panic_fmt at /rustc/936238a92b2f9d6e7afe7dda69b4afd903f96399/library/core/src/panicking.rs:106:14 2: main::main 3: core::ops::function::FnOnce::call_once ```
